Package icyllis.arc3d.engine

Class GpuBuffer

java.lang.Object
icyllis.arc3d.engine.GpuResource
icyllis.arc3d.engine.GpuBuffer
All Implemented Interfaces:
RefCounted
Direct Known Subclasses:
GLBuffer, VulkanBuffer
public abstract class GpuBuffer extends GpuResource
Represents a single device-visible memory region that may be used as mesh buffers and staging buffers. A buffer cannot be accessed by both CPU and GPU simultaneously, it's either locked by engine or executing in command list.

  • Field Details

    • kRead_LockMode

      public static final int kRead_LockMode
      Locks for reading. The effect of writes is undefined.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • kWriteDiscard_LockMode

      public static final int kWriteDiscard_LockMode
      Locks for writing. The existing contents are discarded and the initial contents of the buffer. Reads (even after overwriting initial contents) should be avoided for performance reasons as the memory may not be cached.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      protected final int mSize

    • getMemorySize

      public final long getMemorySize()
      Description copied from class: GpuResource
      Retrieves the amount of GPU memory used by this resource in bytes. It is approximate since we aren't aware of additional padding or copies made by the driver.

      NOTE: The return value must be constant in this object.

      Specified by:
      getMemorySize in class GpuResource
      Returns:
      the amount of GPU memory used in bytes

    • lock

      public final long lock()
      Locks the buffer to be read or written by the CPU.

      It is an error to draw from the buffer while it is locked or transfer to/from the buffer. Once a buffer is locked, subsequent calls to this method will throw an exception.

      If the buffer is of type Engine.BufferUsageFlags.kTransferDst then it is locked for reading only. Otherwise it is locked writing only. Writing to a buffer that is locked for reading or vice versa produces undefined results. If the buffer is locked for writing then the buffer's previous contents are invalidated.

      Returns:
      a valid pointer to the locked data

    • lock

      public final long lock(int offset, int size)
      Locks the buffer to be read or written by the CPU.

      It is an error to draw from the buffer while it is locked or transfer to/from the buffer. Once a buffer is locked, subsequent calls to this method will throw an exception.

      If the buffer is of type Engine.BufferUsageFlags.kTransferDst then it is locked for reading only. Otherwise it is locked writing only. Writing to a buffer that is locked for reading or vice versa produces undefined results. If the buffer is locked for writing then the buffer's previous contents are invalidated.

      Returns:
      a valid pointer to the locked data, or nullptr if lock failed

    • unlock

      public final void unlock()
      Unlocks the buffer if it is locked.

      The pointer returned by the previous lock(int, int) will no longer be valid.

    • unlock

      public final void unlock(int offset, int size)
      Unlocks the buffer if it is locked.

      The pointer returned by the previous lock(int, int) will no longer be valid.

    • onLock

      protected abstract long onLock(int mode, int offset, int size)

    • isLocked

      public abstract boolean isLocked()
      Queries whether the buffer has been locked by lock(int, int), this is mostly used for validation.
      Returns:
      true if the buffer is locked, false otherwise.

    • getLockedBuffer

      public abstract long getLockedBuffer()
      Queries the pointer returned by the previous lock(int, int) if isLocked() returns true, otherwise the pointer is invalid, this is mostly used for validation.
      Returns:
      the pointer to the locked buffer if locked.

    • updateData

      public boolean updateData(int offset, int size, long data)
      Updates the buffer data.

      The size of the buffer will be preserved. The src data will be placed at offset. If preserve is false then any remaining content before/after the range [offset, offset+size) becomes undefined.

      The buffer must not be locked.

      Fails for Engine.BufferUsageFlags.kTransferDst.

      Note that buffer updates do not go through Context and therefore are not serialized with other operations.

      Returns:
      returns true if the update succeeds, false otherwise.

    • onUpdateData

      protected abstract boolean onUpdateData(int offset, int size, long data)
